author: new testament

0.0:
Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to
Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,
0.1: to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus, our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:
0.2: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
0.3: I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,
0.4:
hearing of your love, and of the faith which you have toward the
Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;
0.5:
that the fellowship of
your faith may become effective, in the knowledge of every good thing
which is in us in Christ Jesus.
0.6:
For we have much joy and comfort
in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed
through you, brother.
0.7:
Therefore, though I have all boldness in Christ to command you
that which is appropriate,
0.8:
yet for love's sake I rather beg,
being such a one as Paul, the aged, but also a prisoner of Jesus
Christ.
0.9:
I beg you for my child, whom I have become the father of
in my chains, Onesimus,
0.10:
who once was useless to you, but now is
useful to you and to me.
0.11:
I am sending him back. Therefore
receive him, that is, my own heart,
0.12:
whom I desired to keep with
me, that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the gospel.
0.13:
But I was willing to do nothing without your consent, that your
goodness would not be as of necessity, but of free will.
0.14:
For
perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while, that you would
have him forever,
0.15:
no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a
beloved brother, especially to me, but how much rather to you, both in
the flesh and in the Lord.
0.16:
If then you count me a partner, receive him as you would
receive me.
0.17:
But if he has wronged you at all, or owes you
anything, put that to my account.
0.18:
I, Paul, write this with my
own hand: I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me
even your own self besides).
0.19:
Yes, brother, let me have joy from
you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in the Lord.
0.20:
Having confidence
in your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even beyond
what I say.
0.21:
Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through
your prayers I will be restored to you.
0.22: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
0.23: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
0.24: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
